plugins.name: Pixabay Illustrations
plugins.description:
Pixabay Illustrations Library is a powerful Figma plugin that brings you an extensive collection of high-quality illustrations directly from Pixabay. With thousands of unique designs at your fingertips, you can easily enhance your projects and inspire creativity. Whether you're working on web designs, presentations, or marketing materials, our library offers diverse styles to suit any theme.


Key Features:


Vast Collection: Access thousands of free illustrations in various styles and categories.

Easy Integration: Seamlessly add illustrations to your designs without leaving Figma.

Search Functionality: Quickly find the perfect illustration using keywords or categories.

High-Quality Graphics: All images are royalty-free and suitable for commercial use.

Transform your design workflow with the Pixabay Illustrations Library and watch your creativity soar!

plugins.name: RouteMyPath
plugins.description:
RouteMyPath is a Figma plugin designed for runners, designers, and creators who want to bring their workout journeys into their visual work.


Upload a .gpx file from your running app (e.g., Strava, Garmin, etc.) and RouteMyPath will:

•Parse your route data

•Visualize it as editable vector paths

•Enable custom layout and styling in Figma


Ideal for designing performance recaps, social sharing visuals, or creating unique journey-based content right inside your Figma canvas.
plugins.tagline: A Figma plugin that turns your GPX route data into editable design elements

plugins.name: Design Token Exporter
plugins.description:
The Design Token Exporter plugin allows designers and developers to easily export Figma's local styles and variables into a clean, structured JSON format.


Export color, text, and effect styles


Export all variable collections and modes


Choose between "Variables" or "Styles" before exporting


Copy JSON or download it for use in your design system


Perfect for integrating with codebases using tokens in Tailwind, Style Dictionary, or design systems

plugins.name: Designmate!
plugins.description:
Designmate! is your design thinking sidekick – built right into Figma.


Instead of vague scores or generic advice, Designmate! gives you concrete, context-aware feedback based on real user needs. Just drop in a screen, describe what the user is trying to do, and instantly get personalized suggestions to make your UI more usable, accessible, and delightful.


✨ What you’ll get:


  1. A clear explanation of what’s not working from a user’s perspective


  1. Specific UI/UX fixes, with exact actions to improve the screen


  1. Feedback on clarity, hierarchy, accessibility, copy, buttons, layout & more


  1. Zero BS, zero ego – just real product thinking in your Figma flow


Perfect for solo designers, founders, PMs, or teams looking to improve fast without overthinking it.
plugins.tagline: Your AI design critique buddy – smart UX/UI feedback in seconds.

plugins.name: Iconize
plugins.description:
Transform any Figma design into a complete set of perfectly scaled Chrome extension icons in seconds.


Benefits:

  1. Save hours of manual work - No more tedious resizing and exporting
  2. Perfect proportions - Maintains design integrity across all sizes
  3. Professional results - Vector paths, text, and effects scale beautifully
  4. Chrome extension ready - Standard sizes (16px, 24px, 36px, 48px, 128px)
  5. Batch processing - Handle multiple designs simultaneously


How to use:

  1. Select your design - Choose any frame, group, component, or instance
  2. Run Iconize - Go to Plugins → Iconize → Scale to Icon Sizes
  3. Get your icons - Five perfectly scaled versions appear instantly
  4. Export to PNG / SVG and use - Icons are named icon16, icon24, icon36, icon48, icon128


Perfect for Chrome extensions, web apps, mobile apps, and any project requiring multiple icon sizes. Works with complex designs including vectors, text, effects, and nested elements.

accepted.name: George Valdes
accepted.description:
Post-architect
I like building, marketing, and selling outcomes

Iconize - Figma Plugin
Zenfiller - Auto Form filler
Zensets - Context engine

plugins.tagline: Instantly generate size appropriate icons at 16px, 24px, 36px, 48px & 128px from any design

plugins.description:

Choose text or upload a PNG/JPG, set position, size, color, opacity, and more – all in a simple and intuitive interface.


Features:


Add watermark as text or image (PNG/JPG)

Set position (X/Y), size, color, and opacity

No code or plugins required for recipients – just run and watermark!

Perfect for marking drafts, sharing designs, or protecting your intellectual property before sharing.

developed by Dmitry Chekalin

plugins.name: Typographica
plugins.description:
Typographica helps you quickly create beautiful and balanced font combinations for any project — from corporate dashboards to creative websites.


The plugin analyzes your chosen primary font, project style, and font metrics to generate harmonious font pairs automatically.


What does Typographica do?


  1. Generates Primary + Secondary + Accent font combinations
  2. Takes into account your project style (7 styles: business, corporate, modern, elegant, fun, personal, minimalist)
  3. Analyzes font metrics (x-height, glyph width, weight, stylistic characteristics)
  4. Automatically filters out fonts that do not fit the selected style
  5. Lets you save combinations as Figma text styles and variables
  6. Optionally adds smart descriptions to generated styles
  7. Supports manual swapping of secondary and accent fonts
  8. Works with any available fonts — Google Fonts, local fonts, and Figma-supported fonts


Who is it for?


  1. Product designers — to quickly build solid typography systems
  2. UX/UI designers — to improve readability and visual rhythm
  3. Brand designers — to find well-balanced and creative font pairs
  4. Beginners — to get guidance on what fonts work well together
  5. Experienced designers — to save time and explore unexpected combinations


How does it work?


  1. Choose your project style
  2. Select a Primary Font
  3. Click Change Pairs
  4. Browse the generated font pairs and accent options
  5. Save styles or variables in one click
  6. Tweak and refine as needed


Why use Typographica?


Save time — no more manual font pairing

Get better quality — pairs are based on font metrics and style fit, not guesswork

Flexible — works for classic and modern designs alike

Customizable — easy to adjust pairs or generate new ones on the fly


Styles and Tokens Support


Typographica not only generates font pairs, but also helps you create full-fledged text styles and design tokens in Figma.


You can save your Primary, Secondary, and Accent fonts as reusable Text Styles and optionally as Variables (Tokens) — making your typography consistent across your project and design system.


Style Description Table


Typographica can automatically generate a style description table for your font system — right inside Figma.


It creates a clear, editable table summarizing your Primary, Secondary, and Accent fonts, with suggested usage and style notes.


Perfect for documenting typography choices or sharing with your team and developers.


Typographica is your smart font pairing assistant in Figma. Make your typography cleaner, more beautiful, and more consistent — with less effort.

accepted.name: Andrei Kuznetsov
accepted.description: Templates, UI Kits, Design Systems, Plugins

plugins.tagline: Smart Font Pair Generator for Figma

plugins.name: Radix color palette
plugins.description:
Step 1: Enter a base color in the Accent section to generate a palette.

Step 2: Copy the accent scale generated below.

Step 3: Copy the CSS code from:

.root, .light, .light-theme { ... }

Step 4: Repeat Steps 1–3 for the Dark Theme.

Step 5: Create a collection in Figma with two modes named exactly: Light Mode, Dark Mode (Case-sensitive)

Step 6: Paste the Light and Dark theme CSS into their respective input fields in the plugin.

Step 7: Click the "Create Variables" button.

Step 8: Edit variable names as needed in Figma.
plugins.tagline: Copy Radix CSS code and paste it here to instantly add your custom palette variables to the file.

plugins.name: CSV to Table
plugins.description:
Convierte fácilmente archivos CSV en tablas dentro de Figma.


Con el plugin CSV to Table, importar datos a tus diseños nunca fue tan fácil. Simplemente selecciona tu archivo .csv y el plugin generará una tabla visual editable directamente en tu lienzo de Figma. Ideal para diseñadores de productos, equipos de UX/UI y presentaciones con datos reales.


🔹 Importa datos reales sin salir de Figma

🔹 Transforma automáticamente filas y columnas en capas de texto y formas

🔹 Personaliza estilos una vez importado

🔹 Sin necesidad de conexión a internet – tus datos permanecen seguros


Este recurso es completamente gratuito y no almacena tu información. Solo tú tienes acceso a los datos que importas.


---


Easily turn CSV files into tables inside Figma.


With the CSV to Table plugin, importing structured data into your designs is effortless. Just upload your .csv file, and this plugin will generate an editable table directly on your Figma canvas. Perfect for product designers, UX/UI teams, or anyone working with real data.


🔹 Import real data without leaving Figma

🔹 Automatically transforms rows and columns into styled text and shapes

🔹 Customize your table’s style after import

🔹 No internet connection needed – your data stays safe


This is a completely free community resource. Your data is never uploaded or stored externally.
plugins.tagline: Convierte CSV en tablas editables / Convert CSV files into editable Figma tables instantly.

plugins.name: ui-palette-generator
plugins.description:
Supply a primary color and the plugin will generate accessible light and dark themed ui color palettes. Each palette includes:


Palette

  1. Primary
  2. Secondary (primary analogous, complementary, split compliment left, or split compliment right)
  3. Success
  4. Warn
  5. Error
  6. Info


Background

  1. z0
  2. z1
  3. z2
  4. z3
  5. z4
  6. z5


Palette hover

  1. Primary
  2. Secondary
  3. Success
  4. Warn
  5. Error
  6. Info


Text

  1. base (either #000 or #fff)
  2. light (base @ 75% opacity)
  3. lighter (base @ 50% opacity)
  4. lightest (base @ 33% opacity)


Text on palette

  1. textBaseOnPrimary
  2. textLightOnPrimary
  3. textLighterOnPrimary
  4. textLightestOnPrimary
  5. etc


Clicking "Add to document" will add both the light and dark themes as variable modes. If you're using the free plan, only the selected theme is added.


The plugin UI provides a live preview of the generated palettes in use.
plugins.tagline: Generate accessible light and dark themed ui color palettes

136693.description:

plugins.name: Human Design Map Builder
plugins.description:
This plugin is part of a structured system for generating personalized Human Design maps inside Figma.

It reads structured data from a frame called INPUT_PANEL and dynamically updates the cover, highlights centers, colors gates, and reveals matching sections based on the data.

It ends by copying all relevant sections to a target page (מפות מעודכנות) for final output.

No data is sent to external services, except for a success/failure status posted to a webhook for internal workflow tracking.

This plugin is tailored for a specific document structure and may not function properly outside that context.
plugins.tagline: Automatically build and assemble custom sections inside your Figma based on predefined data fields.

137361.name: Human Design Map Builder
137361.description:
This plugin is part of a structured system for generating personalized Human Design maps inside Figma.

It reads structured data from a frame called INPUT_PANEL and dynamically updates the cover, highlights centers, colors gates, and reveals matching sections based on the data.

It ends by copying all relevant sections to a target page (מפות מעודכנות) for final output.

No data is sent to external services, except for a success/failure status posted to a webhook for internal workflow tracking.

This plugin is tailored for a specific document structure and may not function properly outside that context.
137361.release_notes:
MAP BUILDER – Version 1.1
Release Notes

Added secure status reporting using dynamic tokens pulled directly from the design panel.

Improved user feedback with clearer notifications throughout the map-building process.

Minor bug fixes and internal stability enhancements.
137361.tagline: Automatically build and assemble custom sections inside your Figma based on predefined data fields.

plugins.name: Lazer
plugins.description:
Lazer is a plugin for Figma that provides quick commands to adjust the layout and appearance properties of selected elements. It is somewhat opinionated.


The idea is to leave the keyboard less by creating pseudo shortcuts. By bringing up the Actions input with command + K or command + / and then typing a short code (eg. w.h), the fuzzy search will bring your focus to an action you can execute by pressing enter.


I used Gemini 2.5 Pro to build this.


Features

This plugin allows you to quickly adjust:


Width & Height

w.h - Set Width to Hug

h.h - Set Height to Hug

w.f - Set Width to Fill

h.f - Set Height to Fill

w.. - Set Width (prompts for custom value)

h.. - Set Height (prompts for custom value)


Padding

p.0 - Set All Padding to 0

p.16 - Set All Padding to 16

p.. - Set Padding (prompts for custom value)


Auto Layout

al.. - Set Auto Layout Alignment (opens alignment UI)

al.h - Set Auto Layout to Horizontal

al.v - Set Auto Layout to Vertical

g.0 - Set Gap to 0

g.8 - Set Gap to 8

g.16 - Set Gap to 16

g.. - Set Gap (prompts for custom value)


Border Radius

br.0 - Set Border Radius to 0px

br.8 - Set Border Radius to 8px

br.. - Set Border Radius (prompts for custom value)


Stroke

s.0 - Set Stroke Width to 0

s.1 - Set Stroke Width to 1

sw.. - Set Stroke Width (prompts for custom value)

sc.. - Set Stroke Colour (prompts for custom value)


Fill

f.1 - Add White Fill

f.0 - Remove All Fills

f.. - Set Fill Colour (prompts for custom value)


Text

ls.. - Set Text Letter Spacing (prompts for custom value)

t.s - Set Text Size (prompts for custom value)


General

help! - Show Commands and Shortcuts (displays this list in a popup)


Usage

  1. Open the Actions input with command + K or command + /
  2. Type the short code for the command (eg. w.h)
  3. Press enter (assuming you have your desired command in focus)


* Many commands apply adjustments directly (e.g., w.h - Set Width to Hug).

* The al.. - Set Auto Layout Alignment command will open a dialog for visual alignment selection.

* Commands ending with .. (e.g., p.. - Set Padding) will prompt you to enter a custom value.
plugins.tagline: Shortcuts as quick actions to help you Figma faster

137534.name: Lazer
137534.description:
Lazer is a plugin for Figma that provides quick commands to adjust the layout and appearance properties of selected elements. It is somewhat opinionated.


The idea is to leave the keyboard less by creating pseudo shortcuts. By bringing up the Actions input with command + K or command + / and then typing a short code (eg. w.h), the fuzzy search will bring your focus to an action you can execute by pressing enter.


I used Gemini 2.5 Pro to build this.


Features

This plugin allows you to quickly adjust:


Width & Height

w.h - Set Width to Hug

h.h - Set Height to Hug

w.f - Set Width to Fill

h.f - Set Height to Fill

w.. - Set Width (prompts for custom value)

h.. - Set Height (prompts for custom value)


Padding

p.0 - Set All Padding to 0

p.16 - Set All Padding to 16

p.. - Set Padding (prompts for custom value)


Auto Layout

al.. - Set Auto Layout Alignment (opens alignment UI)

al.h - Set Auto Layout to Horizontal

al.v - Set Auto Layout to Vertical

g.0 - Set Gap to 0

g.8 - Set Gap to 8

g.16 - Set Gap to 16

g.. - Set Gap (prompts for custom value)


Border Radius

br.0 - Set Border Radius to 0px

br.8 - Set Border Radius to 8px

br.. - Set Border Radius (prompts for custom value)


Stroke

s.0 - Set Stroke Width to 0

s.1 - Set Stroke Width to 1

sw.. - Set Stroke Width (prompts for custom value)

sc.. - Set Stroke Colour (prompts for custom value)


Fill

f.1 - Add White Fill

f.0 - Remove All Fills

f.. - Set Fill Colour (prompts for custom value)


Text

ls.. - Set Text Letter Spacing (prompts for custom value)

t.s - Set Text Size (prompts for custom value)


General

help! - Show Commands and Shortcuts (displays this list in a popup)


Usage

  1. Open the Actions input with command + K or command + /
  2. Type the short code for the command (eg. w.h)
  3. Press enter (assuming you have your desired command in focus)


* Many commands apply adjustments directly (e.g., w.h - Set Width to Hug).

* The al.. - Set Auto Layout Alignment command will open a dialog for visual alignment selection.

* Commands ending with .. (e.g., p.. - Set Padding) will prompt you to enter a custom value.

menu.name: al.h - Set Auto Layout to Horizontal
al.v - Set Auto Layout to Vertical

137534.tagline: Shortcuts as quick actions to help you Figma faster

plugins.name: Zephyr Export
plugins.description: Exports a section with all its images as an atlas to the Defold engine. After that you can use your components in the zephyr plugin

plugins.name: Extractor
plugins.description:
Components as you go.


As you design, systems, patterns, and components naturally emerge. With Extractor, you can select your working frames, instantly extract them to a component, and automatically replace the original selection with a component instance.


This approach lets you focus on the details while future-proofing designs and aligning process more closely with development.


Simply select your frames and access the "Extract Component" command using CMD + P.


Feedback form →

plugins.name: JSON to Variable
plugins.description:
You can import a JSON file to create grouped Figma variables. you can download the pre-structured Tailwind color palette JSON file via the link as a starting point:


Tailwind colors structured.json


The following is an example of a correctly formatted JSON:

[
{
"CollectionName": {
"modes": {
"ModeName": {
"GroupName": {
"Primary": {
"$value": "#FFFFFF",
"$type": "color"
},

"secondary": {
"$value": "#F5F5F5",
"$type": "color"
}
},
"GroupName2": {
"primary": {
"$value": "#2196F3",
"$type": "color"
}
}
}
}
}
}
]
plugins.tagline: Import JSON file to variable

plugins.name: Bangalicon
plugins.description:
🔥 Bangalicon - The First Icon Plugin You Will Ever Need For Figma


Now, with a new Plugin of Bangalicon, you can get more than 500 high-quality SVG icons right in your Figma workflow. Bangalicons' curated collection of beautifully crafted icons spanning interfaces, communication, business, media, and more is at your fingertips now. It has been meticulously designed for speed, flexibility, and pixel perfection.


✨ Key Features:


500+ icons: Scalable and diverse as per the requirement.


Live Preview & Insert: You can browse, search, and without leaving Figma, icons can be inserted seamlessly which saves time.


Category-based filtering: Finding what you want is made easier because of organized categories.


Will Bangalicon work on IOS apps? Yes. Whether it is website designing or mobile marketing visuals, Bangalicon for Figma is guaranteed to raise your level of design visually in an instant.


⚡️ Save time and design better with Bangalicon.

World Clock Plugin lets you add real-time clocks for any city around the world. Just type a city name, select it, and instantly view its current time in a beautifully minimal interface.

plugins.name: Nativ Localization
plugins.description: The Nativ Localization plugin allows you to adapt visual content inside Figma to any culture and language (from any culture or language). This includes context-aware translation of editable text inside visual assets, as well as uneditable text that are part of complex pixel arts. The plugin allows you to upload your own glossary enabling you to control translation styles/tones. The translations automatically maintain the same original style in the target culture/language. The plugin also goes beyond text, such as stylistically replacing country flags in a poster based on the localization target.
plugins.tagline: Transform visual assets to any culture and language.

135216.name: Nativ Localization
135216.description: The Nativ Localization plugin allows you to adapt visual content inside Figma to any culture and language (from any culture or language). The plugin allows you to upload your own glossary enabling you to control translation styles/tones. The translations automatically maintain the same original style in the target culture/language. The plugin also goes beyond text, such as stylistically replacing country flags in a poster based on the localization target.

Lokaliser.io is a lightweight, no-fuss translation management plugin built for lean teams who want to scale globally — without dealing with overwhelming tools.

plugins.name: QQT Random Number Generator
plugins.description:
This is a Figma plugin that replaces selected text with randomly generated numbers. It supports both Chinese and English language interfaces, has a clear visual hierarchy, and is simple and intuitive to operate.

Functional Features

1. Range Setting: You can set the minimum and maximum values of the random numbers (e.g., 20 - 50).

2. Decimal Place Setting: You can set the number of digits after the decimal point.

3. Thousand Separator Display: You can choose whether to insert a thousand separator in the number.

4. Custom Prefix and Suffix: You can add custom prefixes and suffixes, such as +, -, %, HKD, ¥, etc.

5. Chinese - English Switch: It supports quick switching between Chinese and English interfaces.


这是一个Figma插件，用于将选中的文本替换为随机生成的数字。支持中英文双语界面，视觉层次分明，操作简单直观。

功能特点

1. 区间设定：可以设置随机数字的最小值和最大值（例如20～50）

2. 小数位设置：可以设置小数点后的位数

3. 千分位显示：可以选择是否在数字中插入千分位分隔符

4. 自定义前后缀：可以添加自定义前缀和后缀，如+、-、%、HKD、¥等

5. 中英文切换：支持中英文界面快速切换
plugins.tagline: This is a Figma plugin that replaces selected text with randomly generated numbers.

plugins.name: SnapCap
plugins.description:
Capture screenshots from any webpage and instantly send them to your FigJam board or Figma Design file in a single click, making it easier than ever to document user experiences as you browse the web.


Please note that to use SnapCap, you will also need to install the companion Chrome extension at snapcap.app/extension


How to Use SnapCap

Installation

  1. Install the Figma plugin
  2. Install the Chrome browser extension, and pin it


Session Setup

  1. Open the FigJam board or Figma Design file where you wish to send screenshots
  2. Launch the Figma plugin and click "Start new session"
  3. Copy the generated session code
  4. Click on the SnapCap browser extension and enter the copied session code


Taking Screenshots

Once your session has connected, click on the SnapCap browser extension anytime you want to take a screenshot and send it to your Figma file. A check mark will be shown on the extension icon to indicate that the screenshot was captured successfully, and it will show up moments later in the Figma file where the FigCap plugin is running.


Ending Session

When you are done taking screenshots, click the End button. If the SnapCap browser extension does not automatically disconnect, you can right click on the extension icon and select "End session"


Demo video and more at www.snapcap.app/
plugins.tagline: Capture screenshots from any webpage and instantly send them to your Figma files

How to Use SnapCap

  2. Install the Chrome browser extension, and pin it

  4. Click on the SnapCap browser extension and enter the copied session code

A check mark will be shown on the extension icon to indicate that the screenshot was captured successfully, and it will show up moments later in the Figma file where the FigCap plugin is running.


Ending Session

When you are done taking screenshots, click the End button. If the SnapCap browser extension does not automatically disconnect, you can right click on the extension icon and select "End session"


Demo video and more at www.snapcap.app/

134331.tagline: Capture screenshots from any webpage and instantly send them to your Figma files

plugins.name: Long side scaling
plugins.description:
Tired of manually resizing images within frames one by one, especially when you need them to fit a specific maximum dimension while keeping their aspect ratio? "Long Side Scaling" automates this task!


What this plugin does:

  1. It finds the first visible Rectangle node with an Image fill inside each selected Frame.
  2. It takes the dimension you provide (e.g., 1040px).
  3. It identifies whether the image's width or height is larger (the "longest side").
  4. It then proportionally resizes the image so that its longest side exactly matches the dimension you entered.


How to use:

  1. Select one or more Frames containing the images you want to resize.
  2. Run the "Long Side Scaling" plugin from the Plugins menu.
  3. The plugin window will show how many selected frames contain a suitable image.
  4. Enter the desired dimension (in pixels) for the longest side into the input field.
  5. Click the "Start" button.
  6. The images within the selected frames will be resized instantly!


Key Benefits:

  1. Batch Processing: Saves time by resizing images in multiple frames at once.
  2. Proportional Scaling: Guarantees your images won't be stretched or distorted.
  3. Consistent Sizing: Perfect for creating uniform image galleries, grids, or ensuring images don't exceed a maximum width or height.
  4. Simple Interface: Easy to use with just one input and one button.


Important Note:

This plugin specifically targets the first visible Rectangle node with an Image fill it finds directly within each selected Frame. Images inside groups within the frame, or images applied as fills to shapes other than Rectangles, will not be affected.
plugins.tagline: Scale images proportionally by their longest side.

130386.name: Long side scaling
130386.description:
Tired of manually resizing images within frames one by one, especially when you need them to fit a specific maximum dimension while keeping their aspect ratio? "Long Side Scaling" automates this task!


What this plugin does:

  1. It finds the first visible Rectangle node with an Image fill inside each selected Frame.
  2. It takes the dimension you provide (e.g., 1040px).
  3. It identifies whether the image's width or height is larger (the "longest side").
  4. It then proportionally resizes the image so that its longest side exactly matches the dimension you entered.


How to use:

  1. Select one or more Frames containing the images you want to resize.
  2. Run the "Long Side Scaling" plugin from the Plugins menu.
  3. The plugin window will show how many selected frames contain a suitable image.
  4. Enter the desired dimension (in pixels) for the longest side into the input field.
  5. Click the "Start" button.
  6. The images within the selected frames will be resized instantly!


Key Benefits:

  1. Batch Processing: Saves time by resizing images in multiple frames at once.
  2. Proportional Scaling: Guarantees your images won't be stretched or distorted.
  3. Consistent Sizing: Perfect for creating uniform image galleries, grids, or ensuring images don't exceed a maximum width or height.
  4. Simple Interface: Easy to use with just one input and one button.


Important Note:

This plugin specifically targets the first visible Rectangle node with an Image fill it finds directly within each selected Frame. Images inside groups within the frame, or images applied as fills to shapes other than Rectangles, will not be affected.
130386.tagline: Scale images proportionally by their longest side.

plugins.name: Frames to Pages
plugins.description:
✨ About the Plugin


Organize your Figma files more efficiently!


This plugin moves each selected frame into its own new page automatically, helping you:


  1. Improve performance on heavy files.
  2. Make navigation faster and more intuitive.
  3. Keep versions and project sections clearly separated.


Perfect for large projects, collaborative teams, and anyone who values a clean and structured workspace.


💡 Why use this plugin?


As Figma projects grow, pages often become crowded with dozens (or hundreds) of frames.

This can cause:


  1. Slower loading times.
  2. Harder navigation and confusion for new collaborators.
  3. Increased risk of overwriting or losing important work.


By splitting frames into separate pages, your file becomes lighter, faster, and easier to maintain.


📚 Common Use Cases


  1. Large projects: Quickly organize dozens of screens into individual pages.


  1. Version management: Save different design versions separately without cluttering a single page.


  1. Developer handoff: Share organized sections with developers more easily.


  1. Team collaboration: Help new team members find what they need faster.


🛠️ How it works


  1. Select the frames you want to organize.
  2. Run the plugin.
  3. Choose whether to delete the original page or keep it.


Each selected frame will be placed into a brand new page, keeping its content intact.
plugins.tagline: Move each selected frame into its own new page automatically. Organize your Figma files easily.
